FuncDef: By default, if the circuit-id/interface-id or remote-id in the IPoE session re-authentication trigger packet (such as a DHCP renewal) is not empty and different from the circuit-id/interface-id or remote-id stored in the IPoE session data, a forced re-authentication is performed, ignoring the configuredmin-auth-interval. This default behavior can be changed with this command.

ParaDef.Info: Perform a forced re-authentication upon a circuit-id/interface-id change. An empty circuit-id/interface-id is not considered a change.
Perform a forced re-authentication upon a remote-id change. an empty remote-id is not considered a change. For DHCPv6, the enterprise number is excluded from the comparison.
Specifies that the min-auth-interval never is ignored. The system does not perform a forced re-authentication upon a circuit-id or interface-id or remote-id change.

ExtraInfo:
Default: force-auth cid-change rid-change 
force-auth disabled on wlan-gw group interfaces
